question.title: How do I download JNativeHook correctly in Eclipse IDE?
question.body:
I wanted to utilize a global keylogger for my project and I went to https://github.com/kwhat/jnativehook/releases for downloading JNativeHook. I downloaded "jnativehook-2.2.2.jar" one and then added it to my project folder. I then configured the class path of my project and applied this file.

However, even though the file shows up in "Referenced Libraries", I simply cannot get the imports to work as they all say "Cannot be resolved". Are there any steps I did wrong or I didn't do? I use macOS for my operating system.

question_comments.body: If you have a module-info.java file, delete it (if needed you can recreate it later via right-click on project and Configure) or in module-info.java add the required requires ...; statement. If this does not help, please provide more information for others to reproduce your issue.
Please add a screenshot of the libraries dialog from Eclipse. Also which JDK version are you using?
